events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident involving a rear-end collision on the highway. Initial claim filing completed.
Claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing the accident description mentioning vehicle collision and damages.
An experienced claims agent was assigned to manage the case and assist the policyholder through the claim process.
The insurance company acknowledged receipt of the claim and confirmed the initial details submitted by the claimant.
Request sent to the claimant for police report, photographs of the damaged vehicle, and witness statements to proceed.
The claimant submitted all requested documents including the police report, photos, and two witness statements.
The investigation into the circumstances of the car accident commenced to determine fault and extent of damages.
Investigation concluded confirming that the claimant was not at fault in the vehicle collision on the highway.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover the repair costs of the damaged car based on assessment estimates.
The claimant provided positive feedback expressing satisfaction with the communication and settlement offer.
The claim was formally approved following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the policyholder.
Payment for the claim settlement was issued to the policyholder’s designated bank account as agreed.
The claim was officially closed after successful settlement payment and confirmation of the claimant’s satisfaction.
